00035 #if !defined(BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION)

00037 BOOST_MPL_AUX_AGLORITHM_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
00038 
00039 template<
00040       bool C
00041     , typename T1
00042     , typename T2
00043     >
00044 struct if_c
00045 {
00046     typedef T1 type;
00047 };
00048 
00049 template<
00050       typename T1
00051     , typename T2
00052     >
00053 struct if_c<false,T1,T2>
00054 {
00055     typedef T2 type;
00056 };
00057 
00058 template<
00059       typename BOOST_MPL_AUX_VOID_SPEC_PARAM(C)
00060     , typename BOOST_MPL_AUX_VOID_SPEC_PARAM(T1)
00061     , typename BOOST_MPL_AUX_VOID_SPEC_PARAM(T2)
00062     >
00063 struct if_
00064 {
00065  private:
00066     // agurt, 02/jan/03: two-step 'type' definition for the sake of aCC 
00067     typedef if_c<
00068 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(__BORLANDC__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(0x561))
00069           BOOST_MPL_AUX_VALUE_WKND(C)::value
00070 #else
00071           BOOST_MPL_AUX_STATIC_CAST(bool, BOOST_MPL_AUX_VALUE_WKND(C)::value)
00072 #endif
00073         , T1
00074         , T2
00075         > almost_type_;
00076  
00077  public:
00078     typedef typename almost_type_::type type;
00079     
00080     BOOST_MPL_AUX_LAMBDA_SUPPORT(3,if_,(C,T1,T2))
00081 };
00082 
00083 #else
00084 
00085 // no partial class template specialization
00086 
00087 namespace aux {
00088 
00089 template< bool C >
00090 struct if_impl
00091 {
00092     template< typename T1, typename T2 > struct result_
00093     {
00094         typedef T1 type;
00095     };
00096 };
00097 
00098 template<>
00099 struct if_impl<false>
00100 {
00101     template< typename T1, typename T2 > struct result_
00102     { 
00103         typedef T2 type;
00104     };
00105 };
00106 
00107 } // namespace aux
00108 
00109 template<
00110       bool C_
00111     , typename T1
00112     , typename T2
00113     >
00114 struct if_c
00115 {
00116     typedef typename aux::if_impl< C_ >
00117         ::template result_<T1,T2>::type type;
00118 };
00119 
00120 // (almost) copy & paste in order to save one more 
00121 // recursively nested template instantiation to user
00122 template<
00123       typename BOOST_MPL_AUX_VOID_SPEC_PARAM(C_)
00124     , typename BOOST_MPL_AUX_VOID_SPEC_PARAM(T1)
00125     , typename BOOST_MPL_AUX_VOID_SPEC_PARAM(T2)
00126     >
00127 struct if_
00128 {
00129     enum { msvc70_wknd_ = C_::value };
00130 
00131     typedef typename aux::if_impl< BOOST_MPL_AUX_STATIC_CAST(bool, msvc70_wknd_) >
00132         ::template result_<T1,T2>::type type;
00133 
00134     BOOST_MPL_AUX_LAMBDA_SUPPORT(3,if_,(C_,T1,T2))
00135 };
00136 
00137 #endif // BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION

00139 BOOST_MPL_AUX_AGLORITHM_NAMESPACE_END

00141 BOOST_MPL_AUX_ALGORITHM_VOID_SPEC(3, if_)

00144 #if !defined(BOOST_MPL_NO_FULL_LAMBDA_SUPPORT)
00145 
00146 // Aleksey, check it out: lazy if_ evaluation in lambdas!
00147 // I think this doesn't handle the case of
00148 //
00149 //    _1<foo<_2>, bar<_2>, baz<_2> >
00150 //
00151 // (or however it is that you express that... when the ordinary bind3
00152 // computes the function based on the actual arguments). That leads me
00153 // to think that some kind of true currying might be a better
00154 // approach, e.g.:
00155 //
00156 //
00157 //  boost::mpl::bind3<
00158 //         boost::mpl::quote3<boost::mpl::if_>
00159 //       , boost::mpl::bind1<boost::mpl::quote1<boost::is_reference>, boost::mpl::arg<1> >
00160 //       , boost::mpl::arg<1>
00161 //       , boost::mpl::bind1<boost::mpl::quote1<add_ptr>, boost::mpl::arg<1> > 
00162 //  >::apply<...>
00163 //
00164 // becomes:
00165 //
00166 //  boost::mpl::bind<
00167 //         boost::mpl::quote3<boost::mpl::if_>
00168 //  >::bind<
00169 //       , boost::mpl::bind1<boost::mpl::quote1<boost::is_reference>,
00170 //         boost::mpl::arg<1> >
00171 //  >::bind<
00172 //         boost::mpl::arg<1>
00173 //  >::bind<
00174 //       boost::mpl::bind1<boost::mpl::quote1<add_ptr>, boost::mpl::arg<1> > 
00175 //  >::apply<...>
00176 //
00177 // so that after the 2nd bind we have a different function depending
00178 // on the result of is_reference.
00179 
00180 template <class T1, class T2, class T3, class T4> struct bind3;
00181 template <template <class T1, class T2, class T3> class F, class tag> struct quote3;
00182 
00183 namespace aux
00184 {
00185   template <
00186       typename T
00187     , BOOST_MPL_PP_PARAMS(BOOST_MPL_METAFUNCTION_MAX_ARITY, typename U)
00188   > struct resolve_bind_arg;
00189 
00190   template<
00191         typename T
00192       , typename Arg
00193       >
00194   struct replace_unnamed_arg;
00195 }
00196 
00197 template<
00198       typename T1, typename T2, typename T3
00199     >
00200 struct bind3<quote3<if_, void_>, T1, T2, T3>
00201 {
00202     template<
00203           typename U1 = void_, typename U2 = void_, typename U3 = void_
00204         , typename U4 = void_, typename U5 = void_
00205         >
00206     struct apply
00207     {
00208      private:
00209         typedef quote3<if_, void_> a0;
00210         typedef mpl::arg< 1> n1;
00211         
00212         typedef aux::replace_unnamed_arg< T1,n1 > r1;
00213         typedef typename r1::type a1;
00214         typedef typename r1::next_arg n2;
00215         typedef typename aux::resolve_bind_arg< a1,U1,U2,U3,U4,U5 >::type t1;
00216 
00217         typedef aux::replace_unnamed_arg< T2,n2 > r2;
00218         typedef typename r2::type a2;
00219         typedef typename r2::next_arg n3;
00220         typedef typename aux::resolve_bind_arg< a2,U1,U2,U3,U4,U5 > f2;
00221 
00222         typedef aux::replace_unnamed_arg< T3,n3 > r3;
00223         typedef typename r3::type a3;
00224         typedef typename r3::next_arg n4;
00225         typedef typename aux::resolve_bind_arg< a3,U1,U2,U3,U4,U5 > f3;
00226 
00227         typedef typename if_<t1,f2,f3>::type f_;
00228      public:
00229         typedef typename f_::type type;
00230     };
00231 };
00232 #endif
